Uses of Class
com.opencredo.concursus.domain.events.sourcing.EventReplayer

  • Packages that use EventReplayer 
    Package Description
    com.opencredo.concursus.domain.events.binding
    Provides the concrete EventTypeBinding class, which captures the aggregate type and EventTypeMatcher for a group of events directed at the same aggregate type.
    com.opencredo.concursus.domain.events.sourcing
    Provides the EventSource and CachedEventSource interfaces, which represent sources of Events.

    • Uses of EventReplayer in com.opencredo.concursus.domain.events.binding

      Methods in com.opencredo.concursus.domain.events.binding that return EventReplayer 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      EventReplayer EventTypeBinding.replaying(CachedEventSource eventSource, UUID aggregateId, TimeRange timeRange)
      Using the bound aggregate type and EventTypeMatcher, replay events for the requested aggregateId from the supplied CachedEventSource
      EventReplayer EventTypeBinding.replaying(EventSource eventSource, UUID aggregateId, TimeRange timeRange)
      Using the bound aggregate type and EventTypeMatcher, replay events for the requested aggregateId from the supplied EventSource

    • Uses of EventReplayer in com.opencredo.concursus.domain.events.sourcing

      Set the order to ascending.

      Set the order to ascending, sorted by the supplied Comparator.

      Set the order to descending.
      EventReplayer EventReplayer.inDescendingOrder(Comparator<Event> comparator)
      Set the order to descending, sorted by the supplied Comparator.
      static EventReplayer EventReplayer.of(List<Event> events)
      Create an EventReplayer replaying the supplied Events.
      default EventReplayer CachedEventSource.replaying(AggregateId aggregateId)
      Get an EventReplayer replaying all events for the given AggregateId.
      default EventReplayer CachedEventSource.replaying(AggregateId aggregateId, TimeRange timeRange)
      Get an EventReplayer replaying events for the given AggregateId within the given TimeRange.
